fields.summary: can't delete tables within a table

fields.description:
Some change in Confluence 3.5.x development caused the dashboard to no longer persist the number of updates displayed on the dashboard when asking the dashboard for 10 updates.

Steps to reproduce:
* Click on "-" on the recent updates
* The dashboard now fewer updates
* Click on the "Dashboard" link on the bread crumb to refresh the dashboard
* The number of updates resets to what it was before "-" was clicked. The state should have persisted.
fields.summary: Cannot reduce number of updates displayed to 10

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-23597].
{panel}
 
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 25th July 2019|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
After some analysis we've found that this issue is actually a limitation in Confluence described by the feature request at CONFSERVER-4337 and confluence is working as designed, so this is not a bug. Please see our [New Features Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/implementation-of-new-features-policy-201294576.html] for more information and watch that request for further updates.
{panel}
*Actions:*
 # Open Word document.
 # Copy/paste text from Word doc into Confluence page.
 # Copy/paste image from Word doc into Confluence page.

*Expected:*
 Text and images copied into the page, images stored as attachments.

*Actual:*
 Text copied into the page.
 _Edge_ - Copied image doesn't paste.
 _IE 8_ - No option to paste images.
 _Firefox 7_ - Image doesn't copy or paste on Mac, works perfectly on Win7.
 _Safari 5.1_ - Image copies and appears in the edit window, then appears as a broken link when saved.
 _Chrome_ - Images copy and paste perfectly on Win7 and Mac. However, after testing it does not work with Win10 and MacOS 10.13.06

*Update:*
 The issue can be reproduced on all recent version of browser.
fields.summary: Copying images from Word documents inconsistent across browsers
Special characters not rendered in Code Macro

fields.description:
Bit tricky to reproduce as caching comes in to play, but here's how I replicated it:

# Insert Code Macro into page.
# In the macro title, enter '获取当前工作目录'.
# Save the page.

Replication method 1:
# Flush Confluence cache.
# Flush browser cache.
# Edit page again, characters in title will show up as empty boxes.

Replication method 2:
# Access your server from another computer, using a LAN or VPN connection.
# Edit page again, characters in title will show up as empty boxes.
fields.summary: Code Macro has trouble displaying unicode characters during edit

fields.description: See attached video, can't reproduce from a clean page, but the attached video will show you it with an existing page on EAC.

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
# insert an info macro
# put two bullet points inside the info macro
# now press shift+up to select both bullet points and press delete (or you can use your mouse to select both bullets and press delete)

Outcome: 
- List items are deleted
- paragraph is removed from macro body (leaving behind a corrupt placeholder where the user is unable to put their cursor in)
Expected outcome: Cursor should be left in the current placeholder 

attached is a video
fields.summary: When a macro placeholder contains only bullet items in its body, the selection and deletion of the body causes corruption of the placeholder

fields.description:
1. The up and down arrow keys move to the next/previous cell rather than the cell above or below.
2. Pasting tables into other applications loses formatting; current workaround is to to copy from the "View Source" version.

Steps to reproduce:

1 - Firefox 6.0

   * When I press the up and down arrows in a table with multiple rows and columns, they are moving up and down rather than left or right

   * I can copy the middle 3 cells from a row and paste it to the bottom of the table, but for that works, I need to use the Toolbar Button
   * First I select the cells that I need to copy;
   * Then I use the "Copy the current row to the Clipboard" in the Toolbar Button;
   * After I use the "Paste the row from the Clipboard to the current row" in the Toolbar Button and the cells are copied normally but this works just with a complete row. If I need to select just one cell, the editor copy the entire row.

2 - Internet Explorer 8

    * When I press the up and down arrows in a table with multiple rows and columns, they are moving up and down rather than left or right.

    * I can copy the middle 3 cells from a row and paste it to the bottom of the table, but for that works, I need to use the Toolbar Button
    * First I select the cells that I need to copy;
    * Then I use the "Copy the current row to the Clipboard" in the Toolbar Button;
    * After I use the "Paste the row from the Clipboard to the current row" in the Toolbar Button and the cells are copied normally;  If I need to select just one cell, the editor copy the entire row.

3 - Google Chrome 14

    * When I press the up and down arrows in a table with multiple rows and columns, they are moving left and right rather than up or down.

    * I can copy the middle 3 cells from a row and paste it to the bottom of the table, but for that works, I need to use the Toolbar Button
    * First I select the cells that I need to copy;
    * Then I use the "Copy the current row to the Clipboard" in the Toolbar Button;
    * After I use the "Paste the row from the Clipboard to the current row" in the Toolbar Button and the cells are copied normally;  If I need to select just one cell, the editor copy the entire row.

OS: Windows 7 Professional
fields.summary: Table Editing Bugs in Confluence 4.0

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-23590].
  {panel}

Please change the documentation theme to support user-specified heading colors.

When I set the color scheme for the standard theme, the Heading Text setting changes the color of headings in the page, including the page title.

When I use the same color scheme for the documentation theme, the headings are black text, regardless of my changes to the color scheme. Why? If I want the nav bar to stay black, I can edit that. Why limit my heading colors.

See attached color scheme for the space at https://digbycms.onconfluence.com/display/LMMALL/LMM+Updates. It all works, but to get the blue headings in the pages, I had to add a color tag to each one. Note that the page titles are black, because you can't put a color tag in that field.
fields.summary: Documentation theme should support the heading text colors set in the color scheme.

Please provide us with migration path from Confluence 2.9.2 to newer version 4.0

fields.description:
Usually, in Confluence a link is opened in the same browser window or tab.
In 4.0 there is an exception of this rule, probably by incidence.

here's the case:
1) create or edit a page which holds a link to another page.
Save the page without going through Preview.
Click the link -> the page opens in the same browser window.

2) create or edit a page which holds a link to another page.
Preview the page, then save it.
Click the link -> the page opens in a new broswer window or tab.
fields.summary: Link target incorrect after Review in Editor (4.0)

fields.description:
In 3.5 (or a bit earlier), tooltips were not available anymore in the Rich editor, but could still be created in the Wiki editor. Either way, existing pages holding tooltips and new pages where tooltips were entered in Wiki mode, they were displayed in the final page.

in 4.0, the new editor provides an "advanced" mode to enter a link in Wiki syntax. This still allows to enter a tooltip.
   \[text|link|tip\]
The result:
   within the editor, the tooltip is shown correctly  (even after save --> re-edit), so obviously the tooltip is stored in the xml source
   but in preview mode and in the final page, the tooltip is not shown.

This is a pity. Can you pls provide at least the fallback method to display tooltips which are entered in advanced mode and also those in existing (migrated) pages, so it is backwards compatible?
fields.summary: Tooltips in Confluence 4.0 "partially" available

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-23583].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

The table's border become invisible after export to a word file, this issue however does not affect Open Office, it only affects user with Microsoft Office. -Thus, Open office can be used as a workaround.- (Unfortunately, the generated files generally don't open correctly in editors other than MS Office, check this: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-26113).

There's a similar bug for PDF exports:
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-34390

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Here is the reproduction procedure: 
# Add a table with wide columns to a new page then save it. (original.png)
# Export the page to the a word file. 
# On the word file


h3. Expected Results
The table fits the file correctly.

h3. Actual Results
The border of the table become invisible. (export+to+word.doc)

h3.Workaround
*Partial workaround*
# Use workaround [here|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-34390] to export a PDF file that shows that table correctly
# Export as PDF
# Use some PDF to Word converter, like [this one|https://acrobat.adobe.com/us/en/how-to/pdf-to-word-doc-converter.html]
fields.summary: The table's border become invisible in the output of the "Export to word"
Conflicting shortcut for paste-special/paste table row

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-23581].
  {panel}

With the new RTE in Confluence 4.0 macros got a placeholder to visualize them better, but this also meant we lost the ability to fast and easily edit macro properties, instead we always have to select the placeholder, click edit and then modify, this causes for a huge step back in productivity.

A Suggestion would be to allow to edit this properties as a direct inline text field.
A First implementation would be one single text-field using the old syntax to separate different properties.
This could cause a number of errors like misspelled parameters etc. But would be far better than what it is now.

Future implementations could improve it even further i guess or the initial could as well, because this might not be the ideal solution I have suggested for a number of reasons, but the dialog is not even a solution, that is an obstacle...

(Attachment is a really quick and dirty mockup)
fields.summary: Edit Macro properties in placeholder header

fields.description:
See the attached video. Here's the markup: {code}
  • foo
  • CURSOR IS BLINKING HERE!
    • bar
{code} If you press backspace you get this markup: {code}
  • foo
    • bar
{code} Notice how the BR is gone, but the second list item is still there. You cannot put the cursor in this list item and its not editable. If you save the page, you get a doubling of the bullets next to "bar" - since both the outer list bullet and the nested list bullet are being displayed. This works on firefox. It produces the following markup on backspace: {code}
  • foo CURSOR IS BLINKING HERE!
    • bar
{code}

fields.summary: Can't unlink

fields.description: Before Confluence 4.0 we linked to various shared locations (files and folders). While this didn't work for all browsers, it worked in IE for those that used it. This seems to be broken now, the old links have been converted to normal text with the path in parentheses after it. E.g. Document XXX (file://j:\\Projects\\XXX\\Reference Documents\\XXX.docx) The reason we link to these files like that is that they are under version control, and the link is to a common location where they are shared. (We all have the J drive set to the same by logon scripts, we can't avoid that). ---- Findings added by [~halatas] (mainly tested on Chrome 19): h5. Behaviors in Confluence || Scenario | Sample#1 | Sample#2 | Sample#3 | || 1. Confluence 3.5.13 (all works(/)) - _wiki markup_ | {code} [foobarDocs|\\\\\foobar.com\dfsrb\DfsDE\foobardocs.doc] {code} | {code} [foobarSpreadsheet|\\foobarhouse\spreadsheet\foobarspreadsheet.xls] {code} | {code} [foobarPreso|\\\C:\Foo\Bar\foobarpreso.ppt] {code} | || 2. Post-upgrade Confluence 4.2.5 - _storage format_) | Link retains correctly: {code} foobarDocs {code} | Link retains correctly: {code} foobarSpreadsheet {code} | Plain text (original link is *lost*): {code} foobarPreso (\\\Y:\C:\Foo\Bar\foobarpreso.ppt) {code} | || 3. Once the page opened in the 4.2.5 editor and saved, although nothing is touched/changed - _storage format_ | link is *lost*:{code} foobarDocs {code} | link is *lost*:{code} foobarSpreadsheet {code} | nothing changed: {code} foobarPreso (\\\Y:\C:\Foo\Bar\foobarpreso.ppt) {code} | h5. Behaviors in browsers: || Browser || Scenario#1.Sample#1,2,3 || Scenario#2.Sample#1,2 || Scenario#2.Sample#3 || || Firefox 13.0 | (/) | (x) {code} http://Confluence-URL/display/SpaceKey/\\\\\foobar.com\dfsrb\DfsDE\foobardocs.doc {code} or {code} http://Confluence-URL/display/SpaceKey/\\foobarhouse\spreadsheet\foobarspreadsheet.xls {code} | (x) no link | || Chrome 19 | (/) | (/) | (x) no link | || IE 9 | (/) | (/) | (x) no link | h5. Steps to reproduce Scenario#2: # In Confluence 3.5.x, add the following wiki markup: {code} [foobarDocs|\\\\\foobar.com\dfsrb\DfsDE\foobardocs.doc] [foobarSpreadsheet|\\foobarhouse\spreadsheet\foobarspreadsheet.xls] [foobarPreso|\\\C:\Foo\Bar\foobarpreso.ppt] {code} # Upgrade to Confluence 4.x h5. Steps to reproduce Scenario#3: Either proceed from the steps above by editing the page then save it. Or you could just simply insert the following in the {{4.x Editor > Insert > Wiki Markup}} which will autoconvert the wiki markup to new storage format on the fly: {code} [foobarDocs|\\\\\foobar.com\dfsrb\DfsDE\foobardocs.doc] [foobarSpreadsheet|\\foobarhouse\spreadsheet\foobarspreadsheet.xls] [foobarPreso|\\\C:\Foo\Bar\foobarpreso.ppt] {code} h5. Unsupported Workaround *Disclaimer: We can't provide any support if you use this method and run into any issues* As seen in the comments, some customers have had success in getting this working by ensuring all links are in the following format: # Type "File:///" not "File://" # use "/" and not "\" for the path (for exampe "file:///J:/Projects/..." # Alternatively you can write "file://server/folder/Projects..." instead of "file:///J:/Projects/..." This was achieved by exporting to XML, running search/replace over it, and then importing it back.
fields.summary: Links to filesystem are lost after upgrade to Confluence 4.x or upon saving the page in the new editor

fields.description:
Highlight text for the purpose of using the autocomplete function creates different behaviours depending if the highlighting was between words or spaces.

1)In the editor, type 'Hello World'

2)Highlight the word 'World' + the space character between the two words,
3)select '[' to initiate an autocomplete and the autocomplete function does not show and removes the highlighted word and adds a single square bracket.

Do the same but highlight just the word and autocomplete behaves as it should.
fields.summary: Autocomplete text

fields.description:
If a macro (implementing com.atlassian.confluence.macro.Macro) throws a MacroExecutionException, one would expect that the exception text gets printed to the user in an error div - this was the behaviour of the v2 renderer if a macro threw a MacroException.

However, this is currently not the case. If a MacroExecutionException is thrown, the error message that is printed is always "null".

Upon inspection of {{com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.view.macro.ViewMacroMarshaller}}, it looks like the MacroExecutionException that is thrown is not caught by the intended handler, because it gets wrapped in an UndeclaredThrowableException by the spring proxy.

This is a bit of a problem because macros may use the exception text to print specific, helpful error messages to the user. "null" is decidedly less helpful. :-)
fields.summary: MacroExecutionException text is not printed to the page when a macro rendering error occurs

fields.description:
Here's the block of code that I'm including within the "code block" macro. When I go to edit the page with the code block macro in it, then the code shows correctly, but when the page is saved it changes to the mangled version. Code as it exists when I enter it into the code block and as it displays when I'm in edit mode for the page:

Blah blah blah blah blah websites

Mangled code that appears after page is saved:

Blah blah blah blah
fields.summary: Code in code block macro gets mangled when http:// is included in <a href="..."> tag.

Hi guys,

fields.description:
There are a number of issues when copying, cutting, and pasting code within a {{code}} block using Chrome, as well as general navigation. For example, I am trying to format some XML. I want to copy the whitespace before one element and paste it in front of another element to get the alignment to display. 

* If I right-click and select copy on the whitespace, the selected text becomes unselected when the context menu appears and I can't copy it. However, I can copy the text with Ctrl-C.
* If I right-click and select paste, the first time I do this nothing happens. The second time I do it, an underscore is inserted (in contrast, if I do the same thing in IE9, a single space is inserted, regardless of how many spaces I had copied; that is also annoying, but in another way) and the interface locks up. I literally can't do anything in the editor. I have to either save or cancel and start editing again to be able to continue working.
* If I use Ctrl-V to paste, it skips the not inserting, then inserting an underscore thing: the whole edit interface locks up up from the get-go.
fields.summary: Copying and pasting white space inside the code macro does not work (right click also causes the selection to collapse undesirably)

fields.description: I have a chunk of XML contained in the \{code} macro. The first line has a bunch of namespaces defined, which makes the line wrap 7 or 8 times. The line numbering of the code macro doesn't detect this and only numbers the number of lines in the XML snippet total. This means that the last few lines have no line numbers and the line numbers for those lines that do have the wrong line numbers.
fields.summary: Line wrapping throws off line numbering in code block macro

fields.description: Whenever copying code into the Code macro, it seems to strip away all line breaks and indentations, this is highly annoying as you then have to manually format all that.
fields.summary: Code macro does not maintain line breaks or code indentations in IE8
Why I can't search for an specific word e.g. "$TOOLS_JAVA"?
Provide the ability to search for page names referenced in 'Include' and 'Excerpt Include' macros on a Confluence page in edit mode.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-23560].
  {panel}

In edit mode, the length of macros are truncated, which means that if you have pages with long names included on the page you're editing, you cannot see the full names of these included pages. This is very problematic if the titles of these long-named inclusion pages only differ towards the end of their titles.

Finding out the full name of an included page now requires manual intervention. In Confluence 3.5, you could simply glance at it in Wiki Markup.

To work around this visual limitation, I've had to rename all the inclusion pages so I can see them at a glance (to work out whether or not they need revising).

Incidentally, expecting a Confluence 4.0 user to simply view the storage format (i.e. XHTML) to see these page names _is not an acceptable workaround_ - especially if you're not going to provide them with a way to edit this XHTML content (in an indented readable format).

*Suggested Solution:*

Extend the length of the macro (displayed in edit mode) to the full width of the edit box.
fields.summary: Show the full name of pages in 'Include' and 'Excerpt Include' macros on a Confluence page in edit mode.

fields.description:
h1. Problem description

Mail page plugin throws:
{code}
org.apache.velocity.exception.MethodInvocationException: Invocation of method 'getEmailBody' in class com.atlassian.confluence.ext.mailpage.ViewMailPageAction threw exception java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: com.atlassian.confluence.pages.AbstractPage.getContent()Ljava/lang/String; at /templates/mailpage/mailpage-preview.vm[line 69, column 25]
at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTIdentifier.execute(ASTIdentifier.java:237)

caused by: java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: com.atlassian.confluence.pages.AbstractPage.getContent()Ljava/lang/String;
at com.atlassian.confluence.ext.mailpage.AbstractMailPageAction.getPageXhtmlContent(AbstractMailPageAction.java:236)
Stack Trace:[hide]

org.apache.velocity.exception.MethodInvocationException: Invocation of method 'getEmailBody' in class com.atlassian.confluence.ext.mailpage.ViewMailPageAction threw exception java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: com.atlassian.confluence.pages.AbstractPage.getContent()Ljava/lang/String; at /templates/mailpage/mailpage-preview.vm[line 69, column 25]
at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTIdentifier.execute(ASTIdentifier.java:237)
{code}

as it is still expecting wiki markup language to send via email.


h2. Workaround.

Recommend you use uninstall the mail page plugin and use the more enhanced [share page|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/E-mailing+a+Page] functionality inbuilt into Confluence 4.0 instead.
fields.summary: Mail Page Plugin reports Invocation of method 'getEmailBody' exception java.lang.NoSuchMethodError

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-23557].
  {panel}

The startup script uses pushd and popd, which may not port to all systems.  A fix is included below:

before:

pushd $SOMEDIR
do_something
popd

after:

PUSHED_DIR=`pwd`
cd $SOMEDIR
do_something
cd $PUSHED_DIR
fields.summary: Startup script requires BASH -- must be sh compatible for Ubuntu

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-23552].
  {panel}

Confluence 4.0 onwards installer bundles only the JRE. This leads to the confusion on end users whether JDK is really required to run Confluence. If it turned out that JDK is not required any more, would be good to make this clear in the docs. Here are couple of pages I found that might needs correction:
- http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Installing+Java+for+Confluence
- http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/System+Requirements
- http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Supported+Platforms
- http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Unable+to+Connect+to+SSL+Services+due+to+PKIX+Path+Building+Failed+sun.security.provider.certpath.SunCertPathBuilderException

Couple of similar CONF issues raised previously:
CONF-6807
CONF-21705
CONF-12311
fields.summary: Clarification whether Confluence requires JRE vs. JDK since the installer bundles the JRE only
Multi-byte characters aren't displayed correctly in Code Block Macro.

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
# type abc (ENTER)
# type def (ENTER)
# now make abc a list item (e.g. CMD+SHIFT+N)
# now try and put "def" just below "abc" in the same list item: go to the start of "d", press backspace
# Now press SHIFT+Enter to make it part of the list item

Outcome: Creates a new line, without "def" in it, places cursor in wrong position. Looks like this:

# abcdef

Expected: Should look like this:

# abc\\
def

----
Attached is a video
fields.summary: Backspacing a sentence into a list item then pressing shift+enter does not produce desired outcome
Support Java 7
Allow users to specify alt and title for images in the WYSIWYG editor

fields.description:
h3.Affected Platforms
Jira 4.4, Confluence 4.0

h3.Symptoms
Some JIRA Directory users in Confluence might occasionally complain that they encounter the "Not Permitted" error while using Confluence, *occasionally*. You will notice this happening after a scheduled/manual sync of JIRA directory in Confluence. 

h3.Steps to Reproduce
# Create an internal user in JIRA (in JIRA Internal Directory) that would have a similar user name with a user in Crowd (Make sure the user in Crowd has multiple group memberships while the user in JIRA only has membership with jira-users group). (Let's call the 2 users "DuplicatedUsers")
# Add the Crowd directory in JIRA.
# Sync the Crowd directory (Crowd users will be fetched into JIRA, including the user with the same username as the user in the JIRA internal directory) 
# Add the JIRA user directory to Confluence
# Sync the JIRA user directory in Confluence (Notice that only one of the "DuplicatedUsers" is synced, but the group memberships are aggregated - DuplicatedUsers would be member of jira-users, as well as all the groups that it is member of in Crowd).
# Try to sync the JIRA directory again, notice that all group memberships except jira-users is gone (and sometimes, even jira-users is gone as well, so zero group memberships).
# Sync the JIRA directory again, and notice that the group memberships are all back again
Notice the logs would have something like this:
{code}
2011-10-11 20:24:47,726 ERROR [scheduler_Worker-7] [crowd.embedded.hibernate2.HibernateMembershipDao] addAllUsersToGroup The following group memberships could not be processed:
2011-10-11 20:24:47,726 ERROR [scheduler_Worker-7] [crowd.embedded.hibernate2.HibernateMembershipDao] addAllUsersToGroup horatio nelson into jira-users
2011-10-11 20:24:47,726 ERROR [scheduler_Worker-7] [crowd.embedded.hibernate2.HibernateMembershipDao] addAllUsersToGroup Please try to resolve any errors with these users and groups, and try again.
{code}

h3.Cause
Affected users appear twice in JIRA; one in the JIRA internal directory, and one in external user management such as Crowd. During sync of the JIRA directory in Confluence, Confluence pulls one user, and aggregates the group memberships of the user from both directories in JIRA (Jira Internal Dir, and Crowd). The aggregation causes constraint violation in Confluence's database, and Confluence will then discard the group membership altogether during synchronization. Since the group membership is discarded in one sync, the next sync will re-add the membership again. Hence, the symptoms described above

h3.Expected Result
Confluence only pulls one user from the higher priority directory in JIRA. The group memberships should not be aggregated, but should only follow the group memberships defined in the higher priority directory. 

h3.Workaround
# Delete the duplicate users by first disabling the Crowd directory (in JIRA)
# Browse for the duplicate Jira internal directory users, then remove them one by one
# Re-enable the Crowd directory in JIRA
# Browse to {{Confluence Admin >> User Directories}}
# Disable the JIRA directory
# Add another JIRA directory with similar settings (but different names)
# Sync the new JIRA directory
fields.summary: Lost user memberships on subsequent synchronizations (Confluence 4.0 to JIRA 4.4)

fields.description:
Consider macro: {macro|val1|param=val2}. {{val1}} is a content of default parameter (without a name), {{val2}} is a content of parameter named {{param}}.

All parameters are passed to execute(). Default parameter is NOT passed to getImagePlaceholder().

Code:

{noformat}
public class ScreenSnipeMacro implements Macro, ResourceAware, EditorImagePlaceholder {

	@Override
	public String execute(final Map<String, String> parameters, final String body, final ConversionContext context)
			throws MacroExecutionException {
		assertEquals("val2", parameters.get("param")); // PASS
		assertEquals("val1", parameters.get("0"));     // PASS
		assertEquals(2, parameters.size());            // PASS
	}

	@Override
	public ImagePlaceholder getImagePlaceholder(final Map<String, String> parameters, final ConversionContext context) {
		assertEquals("val2", parameters.get("param")); // PASS
		assertEquals("val1", parameters.get("0"));     // FAIL
		assertEquals(2, parameters.size());            // WOULD FAIL
	}
}
{noformat}

atlassian-plugin.xml

{noformat}
	<xhtml-macro key="screenshot" name="screenshot" class="com.screensnipe.confluence.macro.ScreenSnipeMacro"
			icon="/download/resources/${project.groupId}.${project.artifactId}:icons/macro-icon.png">
		<!-- Name attribute specifies the macro tag, it's {screenshot}. -->
		<!-- Description is displayed in macro browser below the title. -->
		<description>Snipe a screenshot, add arrows and texts and put directly on page.</description>
		<category name="confluence-content"/>
		<category name="visuals"/>
		<parameters>
			<parameter name="" type="string" multiple="false"/>
			<parameter name="align" type="enum" multiple="false" default="none">
				<value name="none"/>
				<value name="center"/>
				<value name="left"/>
				<value name="right"/>
			</parameter>
			<parameter name="zoom" type="string"/>
			<parameter name="width" type="string"/>
			<parameter name="height" type="string"/>
			<parameter name="border" type="string"/>
			<parameter name="border-color" type="string"/>
		</parameters>
		<resource type="velocity" name="help" location="/com/screensnipe/confluence/macro/help.vm">
			<param name="help-section" value="images"/>
		</resource>
		<resource type="i18n" name="i18n" location="com/screensnipe/confluence/macro/i18n"/>
	</xhtml-macro>
{noformat}
fields.summary: default macro parameter not accessible within EditorImagePlaceholder#getImagePlaceholder
Installer/Upgrader should import SSL KeyStore or allow reuse a custom, existing JVM

fields.description:
When a user attempts to exit a bullet list in IE8 either by using toolbar or Ctrl + Shift + B, the cursor returns to the end of the previous point on the list. (Separate bug for that linked to this issue).

The user can exit the list by hitting [enter], however, this results in an extra line between the list and the subsequent text. 

If they happen to attempt to exit the list by hitting Ctrl + Shift + B and, then, in frustration, hit [Enter] to exit the list and type text, a "'nodeType' is null or not an object" error is thrown when they start typing the subsequent text. +Not a great workaround+
fields.summary: Javascript error in IE8 when in bullet list

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-23528].
  {panel}

Page merging behaviour is different if multiple users are editing a row that existed before they started editing as opposed to a new row they created during their editing session.

Compare the following examples:
Say a page has the following table header only
||Name||Guess||
Two users start editing the page at the same time, they both add a row underneath the header. Both users perceive that they are both editing the first non-header row.
When they save however, both of their rows get integrated without conflict warning
||Name||Guess||
|Roadrunner|Free birdseed?|
|Wylie Coyote|ACME Trap|

While this behaviour is not inherently problematic, it is inconsistent with behaviour in a situation that a user may *perceive* as identical

Take a second example
Say the page above had a table header with a blank first row to encourage collaborators to enter data
||Name||Guess||
| | |
Two users start editing the page at the same time and they both fill in the blank row provided. Roadrunner saves first. Wylie Coyote saves second and is presented with the conflict warning page.
The behaviours in both scenarios in isolation are acceptable, the inconsistency across both scenarios might confuse users. They might wonder why they get a conflict in the second scenario and not in the first and reason that it is a bug.
fields.summary: Page merging behaviour for tables may seem erratic to a user

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-23507].
  {panel}

At the top level of a document, if I choose preformatted text I get these behaviours -
# pressing return ends the preformatted block
# if I had previous lines of paragraph text and then I choose 'preformatted'. The preformat style only applies to the new text I am going to type.

If, within an info macro I do the same as above then I get these behaviours instead -
# pressing return creates a new preformatted block
# choosing preformatted applies the style to the entire content of the placeholder.
fields.summary: Preformatted blocks behave different in a rich text macro compared to in the top of the document

# line 1

###
###

fields.description:
This occurs when editing long pages in a couple of scenarios:

* If a table is added via Insert->Table, it will be hidden from view (you need to scroll down to see it).
* If a new row is added to a table by pressing TAB whilst in a table, the new row will be hidden from view.
* If a table is added via autocomplete, it will be partially obscured.
 
* If a macro is inserted, it is partially obscured.

See [this video|http://screencast.com/t/XEz81n9L2H0P] for examples.
fields.summary: Editor does not scroll to bottom when adding a macro or table

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce*
Create a bullet list (via autoformat or toolbar, doesn't matter)
Enter one or two items and then exit by hitting enter
Attempt to invoke autoformatting, e.g.
{noformat}
*bold*
{noformat}

The autoformatting will not render

Tables, and font formatting cannot be invoked via autoformat either

Can invoke the autocomplete menu with the curly braces OK
fields.summary: IE8 - Cannot use autoformatting after exiting a list

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-23490].
  {panel}

Given a partly filled table, adding additional content will still add new cells instead of putting the change within the old one.  Even after the current fix to CONFDEV-3302

For example: 
| Heading | More Heading |
| First Row A | First Row B |
| | |

And then fill out the last row: 
| Heading | More Heading |
| First Row A | First Row B |
| Second Row A | Second Row B |
Will create a diff like this:

| Heading | More Heading |
| First Row A | First Row B |
|  |  | Second Row A | Second Row B |

I have tried to fix this in daisydiff with no success (well, not without breaking more things).
fields.summary: Adding content to blank table cells adds new cells
We seem to share SQL session between threads

fields.description:

3. But if you keypress up again and go to the end of the first line and hit enter, then type again the text is still bold '

See video for detail
fields.summary: Pragraph return after bold text should remove bold formatting

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

* Create a new page
* Enter some text
* Hit enter
* Create a bullet point and indent it one level
* now select the indented bullet and the text before it and paste it 

Outcome:
* The list item has two bullets on the same line

Expected Outcome:
* The text and list item would appear just as copied.

See attached video for demo.
fields.summary: Copying and pasting an indented list item produces a list item that is decorated with two bullet points side by side

fields.description:
There is a considerable area within the perceivable editable region of the editor where clicking with the mouse will actually de-focus the editor.

You can see the area boundary in the following screenshot. Clicking anywhere between the editor's grey border and the blue one will de-focus the editor.

[Screen shot 2011-08-15 at 10.55.55 AM.png]

This is important because if you either click or drag and drop in this area, unexpected things will occur that may cause you to lose data.
fields.summary: IE9 - There is a considerable area within the perceivable editable region of the editor where clicking with the mouse will actually de-focus the editor.
Copy/pasting nested content broken in Safari 5
